title: Trying to find the bold italic serif font in this flyer... [UPDATE: Now trying to find the sans serif too!]
content:
Trying to recreate this (or something similar) for a motion graphics assignment but all I have is [this fairly lo-fi JPEG](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415062451/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fyoss.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Ad-C.jpg).

What I'm looking for is that bold/semibold and italic serif font in white (for the honorees' names/"Save the date!"/etc.) Identifont and Whatthefont aren't really helping.

Any guesses?

PS - Not in a rush to find the "A Vision for the Future" font (although it's pretty snazzy) and I'm guessing the little sans serif font is Myriad or something similar. But bonus points to anyone who knows what they are!

PPS - Just edited to change title from "sans serif" to "serif." It IS a serif font I'm looking for!

PPPS - Found the font (it's [Tiepolo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415062451/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fwww.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/tiepolo/))! And the script font is [Hemmet](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415062451/http:/www.dafont.com/hemmet.font)! Unfortunately I can't find the sans serif! More explanation in the comments.
author: elliosenor

comments.content:
So I did get a higher def version of the file, and I found that the font I was looking for [ITC Tiepolo Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415062451/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fwww.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/tiepolo/). So there you go!

Thanks also to Ryuk for finding that script font!

Unfortunately, the font I assumed would be the easiest to find turned out to be the hardest. I knew it was a humanist sans serif, but unfortunately most of the usual suspects - Myriad Pro, Frutiger, Open Sans, Source Sans - lack that slab serif on the capital I's, and the ones I'm aware of that do - Tahoma, Verdana - just kinda...don't look right.

Any help?

Similar, but more condensed and the Js don't match  
Officina Sans
